You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Show Account, Contact, and User Information on the My Account Page

To allow a buyer to easily view certain information from their account, contact, and user records directly on your storefront, show the Contact Information section.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set
NOTE By default, a buyer can't edit their account and contact information, but can edit their user information, including preferred language and currency. Optionally, you can prevent a buyer from being able to edit their user information, as well.
IMPORTANT If the buyer's account isn't assigned to an account group, they can't access the My Account page.

You can configure the following parts of the Contact Information section:

Whether the Contact Information section is available in the My Account page menu (1)
The buyer's account, contact, and user record details that B2B Commerce for Visualforce references (2).
Whether the time zone on the buyer's user record displays in the User Information section (3).
Whether a buyer can edit certain fields on their user record that B2B Commerce for Visualforce references (4).
NOTE When you allow a buyer to edit their user information, they can select a different language or currency that your storefront supports. The buyer experiences the storefront in their preferred language, and the price of products and currency of the shopping cart changes to the selected currency.
WARNING If a buyer already has items in their cart and then selects a different currency, B2B Commerce for Visualforce clears all items from the cart. It's possible that some items aren't available in the selected currency.

To configure the user experience of the Contact Information section, update your storefront configuration settings and storefront general settings.

Verify that the Contact Information section is available in the My Account page menu.
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select your storefront (1).
In the Storefront Settings menu, select Configuration Settings (2).
From the Module picklist, select My Account Navigation Bar (3).
Find the Show Contact Information configuration (4), and make sure that its value is TRUE (5).
TIP
If the value is FALSE, click Override in the Action column. Enter TRUE for Value, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	My Account Navigation Bar
Configuration	Show Contact Information
Page	all
Value	TRUE
To show the Time Zone field in the User Information section, set the Show Time Zone configuration of the Registration module to TRUE.
If you enabled the Time Zone field, create a page label for the field label.
On the CC Page Labels tab in your org, click New.
For Page Name, enter All.
For Page Label Name, enter SiteRegistration_TimeZone_Edit.
Specify a Storefront.
For ValueRT, enter the text that you want to appear on the storefront for the field label, such as Time Zone.
Save your changes.
TIP
If you localize your storefront, also create a localized page label record.
If you've enabled page label caching, refresh the cache after you modify page label records to show your updates on the storefront.
Optionally, disable the Edit Profile button so that a buyer can't edit their user record information.
TIP If you want to keep the Edit Profile button, skip this step.
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select your storefront (1).
In the Storefront Settings menu, select General (2).
Scroll to the Storefront Flags section, and enable Hide My Account Profile Edit (3).
Scroll back to the top and click Save (4).
Build and activate a new configuration cache.
SEE ALSO
